outlet.digest: bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
// • Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
• Tab: toggle edit mode
• Esc: send all note offs
• Cmd+A (mac) or Ctrl+A (win): select all shapes
• Backspace: delete selected shapes
• Spacebar: toggle play attribute

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
// • click+drag on a shape ot move it
↪ Add the Alt key to duplicate it
• click on a machine to select it
↪ Add the Shift key to add it to the current selection
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on an shape to delete it

method.name: (tools)
method.description: // @copy DADA_DOC_TOOLS_ZX

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the sampling information regarding the sampling points set via the sample message.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: flush
method.description: The word flush force all the note-offs for notes being played to be sent. This is effective only when the play attribute is set to 1.

method.name: getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: move
method.description: The word move followed the index of a shape and a vector in wrapped (x y) syntax, translates the shape of the given vector. If the index of the shape is 0 or the all symbol, all shapes will be translated.

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: rotate
method.description: The word rotate followed the index of a shape, and an angle (in radians), rotates the shape. The angle can be set in degrees by appending the degrees ° symbol after the number (without any spaces) or by replacing the number with an llll in the form (amount_in_degrees deg). If the index of the shape is 0 or the all symbol, all shapes will be rotated. If a third argument is added, in the form (x y), it sets the coordinates of the origin for the rotation. If no third argument is added, the default center of rotation is the shape barycenter (if a single shape is being rotated) or the origin (0 0) if all shapes are being rotated. The center of rotation llll can be replaced by the barycenter symbol, to specify that rotation must happen around individuals barycenters. Alternatively you can add the "barycenter" symbol as third element in order to specify that coordinates are barycentric coordinates.

method.name: sample
method.digest: Set sampling points and output sampling information
method.description: The symbol sample followed by a list in the form (x1 y1) (x2 y2) ... sets the coordinates of points on the canvas to be sampled, and then outputs the sampled information (see bang). This is equivalent as using the setsample message followed by a bang.

method.name: scale
method.description: The word scale followed the index of a shape and a number, scales the given shape of the factor specified by the number. If the index of the shape is 0 or the all symbol, all shapes will be scaled. If, instead of a single factor, a list in the form (x_scale y_scale) is given, two different scale factors are applied for the X and Y axis. You can provide as third argument the scaling center, in (x y) form. If no center is provided, by default the barycenter is used for single shape scaling, while the origin (0, 0) is used when all shapes are to be scaled The scaling center llll can be replaced by the barycenter symbol, to specify that scaling must happen with respect to individuals baricenters. Alternatively you can add the "barycenter" symbol as third element in order to specify that coordinates are barycentric coordinates.

method.name: setsample
method.description: The symbol sample followed by a list in the form ((x1 y1) pitch_mc1 velocity1) ((x2 y2) pitch_mc2 velocity2) ... sets the coordinates of points on the canvas to be sampled, as well as their associated pitches (in midicents) and velocities (1 to 127), which will be used at playtime. Pitches and velocities are optional, and can be dropped (in which case a default pitch of 6000 and a default velocity of 100 will be used). If the type attribute is set to "Scores", then the syntax ((x1 y1) label1 score1)) ((x2 y2) label2 score2) ... is expected

method.name: setsamplepitch
method.digest: Set pitch of a sampling point
method.description: Each sampling point can be assigned a pitch via the setsamplepitch message followed by a plain list of pitches (in midicents), one for each assigned sample. Default pitch is 6000 (used when no pitches are defined, or when less pitches than samples are input).

method.name: setsamplevelocity
method.digest: Set velocity of a sampling point
method.description: Each sampling point can be assigned a velocity via the setsamplevelocity message followed by a plain list of velocities (1 to 127), one for each assigned sample. Default velocity is 100 (used when no velocities are defined, or when less velocities than samples are input).

method.name: shake
method.description: The word shake followed the index of a shape, shakes the given shape, i.e. randomly modifies its position and orientation. If the index of the shape is 0 or the all symbol, all shapes will be shaken. You can specify via two optional elements the intensity of such shaking, in the form (min_shift max_shift) (min_rotation max_rotation). Where the each value is intended as absolute value (of the shift or of the rotation). The direction of the shift and the rotation are chosen randomly. The rotation always happens around the shape's barycenter. The default minimum shift and minimum rotation is 0; the default maximum shift is one fifth of the mirror size; the default maximum rotation is 10 degrees. A third optional element sets the shaking region, as a circle where each shape barycenter should fall, in the form ((center_x center_y) radius). By default the center is the barycenter of the main chamber, i.e. of the triangle formed by the three mirrors; the radius is by default the mirrorsize.

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: chambercolor
attribute.description: Sets the color for the chamber borders

attribute.name: count
attribute.digest: Number Of Mirror Chambers In Semiplane

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Number Of Mirror Chambers In Semiplane

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: samplingcolor
attribute.description: Color of the markings for the sampling points

attribute.name: showvelocity
attribute.description:
Attribute deciding how the velocity of a sampling point should be displayed: None: velocity must be graphically ignored
Colorscale: by changing the lightness of the point inner color
Colorspectrum: by changing the point inner color over a spectrum of colors (red to blue)
Point Size: by changing the point size

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Sets the sampling metadata type: either a combination of pitch and velocity (simple case) or a complex score.

entry.name: Outlet 5 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.
